intro: Psychotria sambiranensis, commonly known as the Sambiranensis Psychotria, is a flowering plant species native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale green. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
